narrative.fact: ConvertKit launched in 2013 to help creators convert traffic into email subscribers and earn a living online.
Serious creators needed an email platform built for their workflows rather than generic marketing automation, motivating a purpose-built stack.
Rebranding in public to Kit signaled a shift to an email-first operating system with app store, data hub, and free newsletter tier (up to 10k subs).
Core product combined email marketing, landing pages, visual automations, and commerce aimed at creators from the outset.
More than 640,000 creators use the platform and it generates $41MM in ARR with an 80-person fully remote team.
Positioned as an email-first OS with Creator Network recommendations, paid/commerce tools, and an extensible app store rather than a standalone newsletter tool.
Acquired SparkLoop to add Paid Recommendations; about page lists 89 team members across 72 cities as the company scales globally.

story_judgement.reason: Rebrand press release, pricing, affiliate, and acquisition news provide verifiable milestones (creator count, ARR, free tier, M&A).
